newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Philips to start selling PCs again - paper.
newsitem.headline: Philips to start selling PCs again - paper.

text.p: Philips Electronics NV is to start selling personal computers (PCs) again after three years' absence from the market, although it will not return to PC production, newspaper Trouw said on Saturday.
Philips will start selling pocket computers in the United States next month and portable PCs bearing the company's name will soon appear in shops in Asia, Trouw said.
Philips is working with other giants of the computer industry, including Hewlett-Packard, NEC and Microsoft to produce the pocket computers.
For the larger portables destined for the Asian market, Philips will work with NEC and Hitachi. The computers will contain Philips chips.

Philips withdrew from PC production in 1993 as losses mounted, and closed its last PC factory in March 1993. One of Philips' principal problems was that its computers did not accept the world standard MS-DOS operating system.
